TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper extends System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that enables the server to gather information about the capabilities of the browser that has made the current request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class and serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class. This class exposes the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class and exposes the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> type. The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class enables you to replace the original implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities httpBrowserCapabilities) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that this wrapper class provides access to.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets a value that indicates whether the browser is capable of supporting ActiveX controls.
Docs.value: if the browser can support ActiveX controls; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of available control adapters.
Docs.value: The collection of registered control adapters for the browser.

Docs.param: The name of the browser to add.
Docs.summary: Used internally to add an entry to the internal collection of browsers for which capabilities are recognized.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string this[string key] { get; }

Docs.param: The name of the browser capability to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets the value of the specified browser capability. In C#, this property is the indexer for the class.
Docs.value: The browser capability with the specified key name.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports Java.
Docs.value:
if the browser supports Java; otherwise, . The default is .
This property does not indicate whether Java is currently enabled in the browser, only whether the browser can support Java.

Docs.summary: Gets the JScript version that the browser supports.
Docs.value: The version of JScript that the browser supports.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For version number of ECMAScript supported by the browser, see <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper.EcmaScriptVersion%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the major (integer) version number of the browser.
Docs.value: The major version number of the browser.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum length in characters for the attribute of an HTML (anchor) element.
Docs.value: The maximum length in characters for the attribute of an HTML (anchor) element. The default value is the value in the property with the key name of "maximumHrefLength".

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum length of the page, in bytes, that the browser can display.
Docs.value: The maximum length of the page, in bytes, that the browser can display. The default is 2000.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum length of the text that a soft-key label can display.
Docs.value: The maximum length of the text that a soft-key label can display. The default is 5.

Docs.summary: Gets the minor (decimal) version number of the browser.
Docs.value: The minor version number of the browser.

Docs.summary: Gets the minor (decimal) version number of the browser as a string.
Docs.value: A string that represents the minor version number of the browser.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the manufacturer of a mobile device, if known.

Docs.summary: Gets the model name of a mobile device, if known.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of softkeys on a mobile device.
Docs.value: The number of softkeys supported on a mobile device. The default is 0.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the operating system that the client is using, if known.
Docs.value: The operating system that the client is using, if known, otherwise the value is set to "Unknown".

Docs.summary: Gets the MIME type of the type of image content that the browser typically prefers.
Docs.value: The MIME type of the type of image content that the browser typically prefers. The default is "image/gif".

Docs.value: The MIME type of the type of content that the browser typically prefers. The default is "text/html".

Docs.summary: Gets the general name for the type of content that the browser prefers.
Docs.value: The values "html32" or "chtml10". The default is "html32".

Docs.summary: Gets the request encoding that the browser prefers.
Docs.value: The request encoding preferred by the browser.
